title: This is why no one has faith in the behavior system anymore.
body:
I was just playing Lee Sin jungle in normals, and before the game started I told my team I haven't played Lee Sin in a year. Anyways, 8 minutes or so into the game I'm 4-0 and have killed top 3 times and mid once. Bot lane has died 5 times to Vayne Janna as Lucian Taric. Lucian flames me from this point on until the end of the game about 30 minutes in, and constantly tells me to "kill myself," "shit jungler," "come bot come bot come bot," "useless jungle," while spamming pings the entire game every single time I die or any time I go back and buy while he's dead.

The only things I said were, Lucian the lane is lost she will just kill us all so I'm going to get other lanes fed, and stop being so aggressive and calm down. Everyone on the team was talking shit to him about how much of an asshole he was being, and how I was doing well. 

My problem is this: if I said ONE SENTENCE back to him of the shit he was saying it me, I would be banned right now. After the game I know at least 3 people reported him, and I still have got no message of punishment and he is on to a new game. Why do you not ban people like this but the second someone retorts, they get banned instead?

replies.body:
I have plenty of faith in the behaviour system.

It is renewed every time I see people falsely claim innocence in Player Behaviour and Moderation with obviously toxic chat logs.

>Why do you not ban people like this 

They do if there's a pattern of similar behavior. They generally don't ban people for a single game where they say stuff they shouldn't.

>but the second someone retorts, they get banned instead?

They don't, unless there's a pattern of similar behavior. They generally don't ban people for a single game where they say stuff they shouldn't.

Both parties get held to the exact same standards.

I love how this post turned into a completely nonsensical argument about false reports....

{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} {{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}} 

I agree though OP. Reports and what they do aside, there is just horrid behavior that continually permeates nearly EVERY game we get into and I think it stems from a lack of communication and a lack of understanding of the game.

Simply, we don't have enough time to teach someone the game in one game.  So "Can you please ward the tribush and shove the lane and run down to mid to help with a gank because that's what needs to happen since I just ganked top and we forced a recall" (or whatever) becomes "WTF, shit top" (after mid gets rekt, and no one wants to take the time to explain why).

Poor example maybe but I hope you get the point.

I'm hoping RIOT has taken a turn toward helping people understand the game and how to play it.  It seems like they have with new goodies for next season. But time will tell.

I'm not sure I follow your logic.

Do you think the system is favoring him somehow? That's just blatantly untrue. What is likely the case is that this person hasn't built up enough reported games to flag the system at the time of your report.

The same would apply to you if you presented poor behavior in your games. Unless it's extremely poor conduct, a single game does not give you a punishment. And when it is extremely poor conduct, it's usually escalated through a manual review.
If you get falsely reported a lot the legit reports have little to no weight, so if you manage to get reported even if you didn't do anything by the system you can make sure you never get punished.

No, that's the opposite of how report weight works. The person *making* the report loses report weight for making false reports, the person reported isn't gaining some sort of report protection for it.
That's how report system works in automated systems normally... unless riot is different than how its handled in business IT.

That doesn't make any sense, but here's a reference for you if you care.

http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=4737274&page=13#post48926281

Yes that's right from the one reporting. But also works if you are the one being reported, this is to alleviate being reported by a group of people falsely over and over again (even if its a big group and they only report you once each). It's not only pertaining to League of Legends but how IT networking handles these cases.
References, please. IT networking is not relevant here.
